inscription: Sanskrit inscription in Tibetan transliterated lantsha skript, dedicated to Mahakala, reads: ‘Om sri ma ha ka la ya hum phat sva ha.'
text: Tibetan lamas use such choppers and other knifelike implements to cut off and destroy the temporal, or worldly, attachments and passions of the practitioner. The blade symbolizes the wisdom of nonattachment, and the vajra handle indicates the unstoppable and indestructible essence of the Buddha’s teachings.
title: Vajra chopper knife
